intro: Guettarda amblyophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often glossy and dark green in color. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Guettarda amblyophylla is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
